column4: I just have to figure out how to get it to load the module automagically.
now, rajeev I'm sorry, but gnomefreak can help you out much better than I.
hello.
how do I add a module to be loaded at start up?
this thing seems to think that /etc/rc.d/init.d/vpn_client is where /etc/init.d/vpn_client is located.
but can someone tell me where the startup scripts are located?
depends on which ones you are refering to
the file /etc/modules - is a list of modules to be auto-loaded
you could ask a more detailed question..
how would I make it for write?
from the error message - sounds like there is a 'force' option - thats proberly documented in the man pages for 'mount'
also sounds like it could trash the drive
the porblem is that it was auto mounte.
you are getting beter at asking the questions at least. :P sorry i dont have an ipod.. or any other info to help. you may want to check the ubuntu wiki/forums however.
woudl you have any idea how to deal with changing what the auto mounter does?
not really. i tend to mount my stuff manually for total controll.
this won't let me mount manually :-/.
can you give me instructions on how to get this thing to mount manually so that I can force it to mount as write?
im not sure you want to be using the HFS+ stuff. (i dont have an ipod so cant tell ya much more)
make a fstab file entry that mounts it whever ya want, and check tehman page for mount as to what 'option' to give it for 'force' the rw I guess.
/dev/ipod  /mnt/ipod  hfsplus  async,nodev,nosuid,user,rw,noauto 0 0
